conclusion: To solve the problem, analyze the image to understand the setup of the metal rod and the positions it slides to, then apply electromagnetism principles.
The image shows a metal rod with resistance R, initially in position ab, sliding to position a'b' along a smooth horizontal rail, positioned between two sets of magnets.
The rod moves at speeds v1 and v2 with a given ratio of v1:v2 = 1:2.
The metal rod has a resistance of R and is moving at speeds v1 and v2.
The ratio of the speeds is given as v1:v2 = 1:2.
The induced EMF in the rod is proportional to the speed, so ε1 = v1 and ε2 = v2.
The ratio of the loop currents is I1/I2 = ε1/ε2 = v1/v2 = 1/2.
The power of the external forces is proportional to the square of the speed: P1/P2 = (v1/v2)² = (1/2)² = 1/4.
The ratio of the loop currents is 1:2, and the ratio of the powers of the external forces is 1:4.
